Package boundary

Class Menu

  • Object
    • Menu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoginMenu, StaffMenu, StartMenu, StudentMenu
    public abstract class Menu
extends Object

    Abstract class to define a menu class A menu class is responsible for showing the ui for a specific menu It also has a helper function to help with menu input

    Since:
    1-11-2023
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sim Yi Wan Terence

      Interface to represent a function called by menu e.g.

    • Method Detail

      • getUi

        public ConsoleUI getUi()

      • getChoice

        protected int getChoice​(int lower,
                        int upper,
                        int exit)
        helper function to get input for a choice
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower bound of choice number
        upper - the upper bound of choice number
        exit - the choice at which to exit
        Returns:
        0 for exit, negative for invalid, else returns choice chosen

      • addMenuFunction

        protected void addMenuFunction​(int choice,
                               Menu.MenuFunctionInterface func)
        Function to add a menu function to functionMap
        Parameters:
        choice - choice integer to map to
        func - menu function to call

        The following explanation is for how to use this function: There are 3 ways to implement the MenuFunctionInterface other than simply creating a new concrete class file.

        1. Create the class inline.

          addMenuFunction(choice, new MenuFunctionInterface() { public void doFunction(Menu menu) {myFunc();} });

        2. Use lambda / arrow notation.

          addMenuFunction(choice, (menu) -> myFunc(menu));

        3. Use method reference. Note this only works if myFunc matches signature of doFunction() in the interface.

          addMenuFunction(choice, this::myFunc);

      • removeMenuFunction

        protected void removeMenuFunction​(int choice)
        function to remove a menu function from functionMap
        Parameters:
        choice - menu function to remove based on choice

      • runMenuFunction

        protected boolean runMenuFunction​(int choice)
        Call to run a menu function from functionMap. Assumes choice is valid. Use getChoice to ensure invalid choices are caught. Depends on initialized function map that correspons to choices.
        Parameters:
        choice - the choice chosen from e.g. getChoice
        Returns:
        returns whether this menu should exit

      • show

        public abstract boolean show()
